Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2013 06:35AM hattiehat wrote: hi so went for the appointment and had the scan today nothing obvious on uss, but they will do biopsy and mammogram next. I've been advised by my friend to try and peruse an MRI. So take it all as it comes. Thanks again

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2013 12:07AM hattiehat wrote: thanks guys. It's 5am on the morning of the appointment and I'm just lying here awake. My main concern is leg pain that I've got as well....hoping the breast problem and that are not linked!! Will let you know how it goes and thank you again
Posts.Title: breast indentation hattiehat lucyrosie

Posts.Content: hattiehat wrote: hi there, I am a 29 year old from the UK a few weeks ago I noticed when I raised my left arm that an indentation appeared on my left breast. I couldn't feel an obvious lump. Saw the GP who also couldn't feel anything and refered me to breast clinic appointment for this Thursday. I think after lots of feeling around I can feel like a super thin thread like cord there, but only when arm raised not at rest. To be honest I am pretty scared, the whole presentation for me is very suspicious. The wait is really unsettling :-( anybody else similar symptoms? X Log in to post a reply
